setup.question: What is the relationship between Gavin and the First Officer like?
answers: Gavin learns important lessons in leadership from him
Gavin trusts him so much as to go together on space expeditions, but not further

Text.text:
First Officer Nagurski used to be Captain, and thus Captain Gavin turns to him for leadership lessons on how to work with the crew. 
Ev: for Nagurski as a past Captain:
says. He tells Gavin to ease up, to

Nagurski then gives Gavin advice, telling him to treat the crew like he treats his dog (evidence of this if necessary), and Gavin listens to his advice enough that he even refers to that conversation after the space expedition, even saying.
Also, there is no concrete proof of Gavin's level of trust in Nagurski.
Gavin trusts the First Officer to go on space expeditions, but that trust ends there largely because Gavin is largely skeptical and reserved regarding Nagurski's ambition and trust of spacemen.

Even if it is true that Gavin learned lessons in leadership from Capt. Nagurski, Gavin still had doubts. For example, one might grow up learning a lot from their parents,  but over time, one begins to have their own thoughts and ideas and will disagree with that parent on some issues. That isn't to discredit the learning done prior but shows that growth can change minds.

Im split on this because the 2 answers don't necessarily contradict each other. B: Is there any evidence that the trust is limited to space expeditions? Is this mentioned anywhere?
A: Can you contextualize B's quote to indicate that this is not to show lack of tryst between Gavin and Nagurski. Maybe it is just general leadership advice?
Context: B's quote is from the same leadership conversation I used, and is NOT directed at Nagurski but rather at the crew that Gavin is trying to learn to handle betterfrom Nag:
This is Nag's response:
Also, Gav clearly trusts Nag beyond just going on space expeditions, because he asks him for ideas on how to deal with problems he doesn't ask anyone else.
Nagurski also plays the role of peacemaker between Gav and the man he's been having trouble with, Quade.
, all showing the level of trust btw them.

This debate was reassigned to me so I might be arguing via a different approach. Take my previous speeches with some weight but not complete because they were written by someone else.

First Gavin definitely doesn't learn any important lessons because Gavin is Quade's senior. He even

. 
Secondly, Gavin clearly has some issues with Quade:

.

.
Also this line from early on which Gavin tells First Officer Quade,

.
Pretty open and shut debate.

The evidence is sparse and not conclusive. If debater A is correct that the quote from B was taken out of context, then id lean towards debater A, but even this is unclear: how can i tell that this is directed at the crew?
Debater B: Either I am confused about who is who, or you are mixing up Quade and Nagurski?  I thought Nagurski was the first officer.

Judge B didn't even read the question - they are mixing up Quade and Nagurski. Gavin and Quade have extensively argued, and all of B's ev are for Quade, not Nagurski. A

More on Nagurski - Gavin asks him about leadership:
This entire convo is OUTSIDE of the expedition they go on, if Gavin didn't trust him why would they even chat like this? Even more ev:

. Nag is FO -
Easy 99% A ballot.
My apologies on the Nagurski stuff lmao - that is embarassing. But don't be convinced just yet - there's clearly an immense amount of subtle dissent between nagurski and Gavin.
. Clearly there's some turmoil/clash between the two such that a rift of trust exists.

ayooo this yo third judge. kinda messy but I'm willing to put all the eggs in the basket for A. B switched people argued for completely different approaches which is pretty fair. Didn't like the first speech because the quote was clearly a conversation of Gavin talking to Nagurski nothing explicit about what Gavin thinks about Nagurski just what he thinks about his crew overall. Definitely still can be convinced on this point. But this goes completely unadressd in the subsequent debates by B. Both later goes on tangents about Quade who frankly I dont give a quack about. 
A's opening speech was very good.
#ACAB
Respond to each othe please
still don't know, please refute each other
I have to vote A since B argued for the wrong question lol

answers.reason for outcome: reassigned + dishonest = bad mix. also i confused some characters do long time between rounds. my b

I think B was all over the place for different reasons. Did not seem like a reliable debater. I judged this round more on the repute of the debaters than the actual content. A had a pretty good first speech that established A as the leading answer and B had to job of disproving and proving their own case.

honestly it's been so long I don't even remember, but I do feel like it's unfair that current B had to take over from past B; felt like it gave me an advantage. But also I feel like it should have been over round 1, B's first speech literally acknowledges that Gav learned leadership lessons from Nag.
B argued for the wrong question LOL
